intro: Pycnoloma murudense, commonly known as the Murudense Pycnoloma, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
